As an AI language model, I can definitely give some tips and recommend some sources that can help in finding local artisans or craftsmen when you are traveling. Here are some tips:

1. Ask locals - locals are usually the best source of information about where to find local artisans and craftsmen.

2. Visit local craft markets - markets are usually the hub of local artisanal traditions, and most cities have markets or fairs dedicated to selling local crafts.

3. Look for co-op or artisanal shops - many communities have stores, cooperatives, or galleries dedicated to selling local arts and crafts.

4. Check out online resources - there are many websites that help travelers find local artisanal traditions or local craftspeople. Here are some websites that you might find helpful:

a. Etsy: Not only does Etsy offer an online marketplace for handmade and vintage items, but the website has a "local" section that can help you find artisans and crafters in the area.

b. TripAdvisor: TripAdvisor offers a "things to do" section that can help you find local markets, shops, and galleries.

c. Culture Trip: Culture Trip is a global travel website that offers information on local arts, culture, and events.

d. Craft Map: Craft Map is an online directory of over 1,500 craft shops and galleries around the world. 

Remember to always do your research when purchasing from artisans or craftsmen to ensure that your purchase is authentic and worthwhile.
